## Lead Assessment

**Global markets slide as tech valuations crack and Fed-cut hopes recede.**

* European equities plunged (STOXX600 down ~1.3%) on 18 Nov amid diminished expectations of a near-term Federal Reserve interest-rate cut and concern around AI/tech valuations. ([Reuters][1])
* U.S. benchmark S&P 500 slipped below its 50-day moving average — a technical red-flag for breadth and sentiment. ([Reuters][2])
  **We assess** systemic risk-sentiment is elevated and a pull-back may deepen absent positive catalysts. **(Moderate–High confidence)**

* **Business/financial implications:** Shipping risk on Black Sea routes elevated; grain-export volumes remain vulnerable; energy-grid firms exposed.

### Africa / Sahel–Horn–Sudan

* No major new developments this cycle. **(Low confidence)**
